value: The MV Coho loading cars for its last trip of the day to Victoria, BC

), one can drive directly to Port Angeles in just 2.5 hours (via I-5 S, WA-16 W, WA-3 N & WA-101).
The William R. Fairchild International Airport (
) is located on the west side of the city. Currently, Kenmore Air flies 7 daily round-trip flights in and out of Fairchild between Port Angeles and Seattleâ€™s Boeing Field

, 2 to 4 times a day depending on the season.  The Coho itself, being a classic 1959 ferry, practically makes the journey worth it.  $17 foot passengers, around $60 for car + driver.

If you're coming from the other side of Puget Sound, Washington State Ferries
is nestled in the nook of Ediz Hook and is a direct route from
. It is a perfect stop over for boaters plying the waters of the Strait of Juan de Fuca and

heads west from Port Townsend.  As of 2011 it is under construction, but reaches Port Angeles, and beyond to Lake Crescent.  The section east of Port Angeles is an well marked car free trail, much of which is paved, and easy to traverse on a loaded touring bicycle.  West of Port Angeles is the "adventure" part of the trail, for which a cross-country mountain bike is recommended.  The trail is non-technical single track, making it a introductory level XC, challenging but doable on a loaded touring bicycle.

Numerous places to dine or to just grab a bite to eat.

value: content=This is a true classic American drive-thru. You will be instantly transported back to your childhood by the sights and most importantly the smells of the great food cooking there.
content=If you are looking for great American style Chinese then look no further. They have a great feel and atmosphere to them and the food is second to none.
price=Dorm beds at $18 per night, private rooms at $35 per couple, children under 14 at $6
content=A replica of George Washington's home located along the Strait of Juan de Fuca between Sequim and Port Angeles.
- As one of Port Angeles' next door neighbors, it is a bit more rural and still offers somewhat of a small-town atmosphere.
- Take the Olympic Loop for a scenic drive around the Olympic Peninsula, including the Hoh Rain Forest and Stephenie Meyers' 'Twilight' town of Forks.
